subject: Leadership
title: Managing Up
description: Learn Managing Up in one minute.

hook.text: An employee has great ideas but can never get her boss to act on them. She thinks the boss doesn't care. She's wrong.

buildup.text: Managing up is adapting your communication to your leader's style, priorities, and constraints. It's not manipulation.

discovery.text: Every leader has a preferred mode: some want data, some want stories, some want options. Match their style, not yours.

twist.text: Managing up isn't about pleasing the boss. It's making the relationship productive. Both sides benefit from alignment.

climax.text: Study your leader: what do they value, how do they decide, when are they most receptive? Adapt your pitch accordingly.

punchline.text: Great followers shape their leaders just as much as leaders shape them.

quiz.question: What does managing up mean?
options: Adapting communication to your leader's style and priorities
Bypassing your boss to higher leadership
